text: Jean Lyndsey Torren Marsh (1 July 1934 â€“ 13 April 2025) was an English actress and screenwriter who appeared mostly on television. Marsh co-created and starred in the television series Upstairs, Downstairs, and created The House of Elliot.Jean Marsh 1993. The House of Eliott. Sidgwick & Jackson. 978-0283061554; St Martin's Press (1994) She also starred in Doctor Who, and appeared in many other series, and in films. She got an Emmy Award for the Outstanding Lead Actress for the role of the parlourmaid Rose Buck in Upstairs, Downstairs. Marsh died on 13 April 2025 in London, England from problems caused by dementia at the age of 90. == References == Category:English television actors Category:1934 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Deaths from dementia Category:Actors from London Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Writers from London Category:English movie actors Category:English stage actors
title: Jean Marsh
